description: Provides a pre-signed Amazon S3 URL in response for uploading the file directly to S3. For security recommendations, see Amazon Connect Chat security best practices. The Amazon Connect Participant Service APIs do not use Signature Version 4 authentication.

parameters.name: ContentType
parameters.description: Describes the MIME file type of the attachment. For a list of supported file types, see Feature specifications in the Amazon Connect Administrator Guide.

parameters.name: AttachmentSizeInBytes
parameters.description: The size of the attachment in bytes.

parameters.name: AttachmentName
parameters.description: A case-sensitive name of the attachment being uploaded.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If not provided, the Amazon Web Services SDK populates this field. For more information about idempotency, see Making retries safe with idempotent APIs. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: ConnectionToken
parameters.description: The authentication token associated with the participant's connection.

nested_items.name: AttachmentId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the attachment.

nested_items.name: UploadMetadata
nested_items.description: The headers to be provided while uploading the file to the URL.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: This is the pre-signed URL that can be used for uploading the file to Amazon S3 when used in response to StartAttachmentUpload.

nested_items.name: UrlExpiry
nested_items.description: The expiration time of the URL in ISO timestamp. It's specified in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ. For example, 2019-11-08T02:41:28.172Z.

nested_items.name: HeadersToInclude
nested_items.description: The headers to be provided while uploading the file to the URL.
